paper_abstract: We study in detail the fitness landscape of a difficult cellular automata computational task: the majority problem. Our results show why this problem landscape is so hard to search, and we quantify the large degree of neutrality found in various ways. We show that a particular subspace of the solution space, called the "Olympus", is where good solutions concentrate, and give measures to quantitatively characterize this subspace.
paper_title: Neutral fitness landscape in the cellular automata majority problem
